result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davonte K. Harvala

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Scheduling conference on August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:05 PM Defendant Davonte K. Harvala in court.  Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Claire Elisabeth Barth in court for Davonte K. Harvala. 
Preliminary hearing held. Testimony presented. Probable cause found. Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.
Minutes.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.   
Initial appearance is reset to 05-02-22 at 1:30 p.m. to allow public defender more time to appoint counsel.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 04-04-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:10 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Davonte K. Harvala appeared by video, in custody.  Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  He must sign up on this matter also.  Initial appearance is reset to 03-28-22 at 2:15 p.m.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 28, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of obstruct officer, bail jumping, disorderly conduct, threat to law enforcement officer.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-21-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $250.00 cash bond with the conditions that defendant must have no contact with V.C.V. DOB: 11-20-1987, B.A.V. DOB: 02-29-1960, K.M., DOB: 02-07-2005, J.M. DOB: 02-09-2006, residence 204 N. 8th Street, #804, Manitowoc, WI 54220 and residence 1124 S. 11th Street, Manitowoc, WI  54220.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 03-16-2022
